name: Summer 2025 Undergraduate Research Program Accepting Applications
description: The Summer 2025 Undergraduate Research Program is accepting applications as of April 1, 2025.\nUndergrad students may pursue research as a paid URP assistant working in the labs with RPI faculty researchers. The sponsoring department or faculty is responsible for the financial support a URP student assistant receives, with a matching fund up to $500 provided by the Office of Undergraduate Education.\nThe deadline to apply is May 30, 2025, for more info please visit the attached link.
contact: Tuesday, April 1, 2025 12:00 AM - Fri , May 30, 2025 5:00 PM  Where: Online  Description: The Summer 2025 Undergraduate Research Program is accepting applications as of April 1, 2025.\nUndergrad students may pursue research as a paid URP assistant working in the labs with RPI faculty researchers. The sponsoring department or faculty is responsible for the financial support a URP student assistant receives, with a matching fund up to $500 provided by the Office of Undergraduate Education.\nThe deadline to apply is May 30, 2025, for more info please visit the attached link.   Cooper Gangemi
type: Office for Research, Undergraduate Students, Morning Mail, Morning Mail - Students, Research Administration and Finance

name: CASE Research Exhibited at Time Space Existence
description: CASE is proud to feature research in Time Space Existence, a biennial exhibition hosted by ECC Italy running from May 2025 through November 2025.\nThe group exhibition invites international architects, designers, artists, academics, and researchers to engage with the pivotal theme of Repair, Regenerate, and Reuse. The show presents a dynamic array of works that offer innovative responses to some of the most urgent environmental, environmental, social, and cultural challenges of our time.
location: Palazzo Mora Strada Nova, 3659 Venezia VE, Italy 30121
contact: Where: Palazzo Mora Strada Nova, 3659 Venezia VE, Italy 30121  Description: CASE is proud to feature research in Time Space Existence, a biennial exhibition hosted by ECC Italy running from May 2025 through November 2025.\nThe group exhibition invites international architects, designers, artists, academics, and researchers to engage with the pivotal theme of Repair, Regenerate, and Reuse. The show presents a dynamic array of works that offer innovative responses to some of the most urgent environmental, environmental, social, and cultural challenges of our time.   Kathie Brill 7187551688

name: Pittsburgh Building Closed for Renovations This Summer
description: The Pittsburgh Building will be fully closed for renovations beginning Monday, May 12, and will remain inaccessible through Wednesday, August 21. During this period, no access will be permitted for any faculty, staff, students, or visitors. Please plan accordingly. Thank you for your cooperation as we work to improve our facilities.
contact: Monday, May 12, 2025 12:00 AM - Thu , August 21, 2025 12:00 AM  Where: Pittsburgh Bldg.  Description: The Pittsburgh Building will be fully closed for renovations beginning Monday, May 12, and will remain inaccessible through Wednesday, August 21. name: Archer Center Professional Leadership Program Recruiting for Summer 2025
description: The Archer Center for Student Leadership Development is recruiting students for the summer cohort of the Professional Leadership Program (PLP). PLP meetings are Wednesdays from 6-8pm from June 4th - August 13th and dinner is provided. The program includes industry networking opportunities to help participants sharpen their leadership awareness, knowledge, and skills. If you are interested, contact Susan Henry at henrys3@rpi.edu or Susan Henry on Webex.
contact: Thursday, May 15, 2025 - Wed , May 28, 2025 (all day)  Where: CBIS Bruggeman Room  Description: The Archer Center for Student Leadership Development is recruiting students for the summer cohort of the Professional Leadership Program (PLP). PLP meetings are Wednesdays from 6-8pm from June 4th - August 13th and dinner is provided. The program includes industry networking opportunities to help participants sharpen their leadership awareness, knowledge, and skills. If you are interested, contact Susan Henry at henrys3@rpi.edu or Susan Henry on Webex.   Amy Youmans 5182762288

name: Graduate Christian Fellowship Bible Study
description: Graduate Christian Fellowship is a group of graduate students who regularly meet for a meal and Bible study throughout the Fall and Spring semesters. We meet in the Library Conference Room from 6:00pm to 7:30pm every Tuesday. Anyone is welcome to come.
contact: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM  Where: Library Conference Room  Description: Graduate Christian Fellowship is a group of graduate students who regularly meet for a meal and Bible study throughout the Fall and Spring semesters. name: Troy Compost seeks Volunteers
description: Troy Compost has been organizing a number of big composting initiatives in Troy, such as the Farmer's Market foodscraps collection, a project that diverts food waste from landfills to get composted at local farms instead. Volunteering with us is a 2-hour, low-intensity, educational gig that does good work for a community organization, local farms, and the Troy waste stream. You don't have to be an expert on compost to help out. Contact Guy Schaffer at schafe@rpi.edu for more information.
contact: Saturday, May 24, 2025 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM  Where: Campus-wide  Description: Troy Compost has been organizing a number of big composting initiatives in Troy, such as the Farmer's Market foodscraps collection, a project that diverts food waste from landfills to get composted at local farms instead. Volunteering with us is a 2-hour, low-intensity, educational gig that does good work for a community organization, local farms, and the Troy waste stream. You don't have to be an expert on compost to help out. Contact Guy Schaffer at schafe@rpi.edu for more information.   Green Greeks
